Returns: An integer representing the precedence, 0 being the lowest.
getPresencePrecedence(int).Description: Returns the precedence of the status code the higher number being the higher precedence.
getPresencePrecedence(int).FullName: public static final int getPresencePrecedence (int status)

Returns: the resource ID for the proper presence icon
Parameters: int: the status to get the icon for
getPresenceIconResourceId(int).Description: Gets the resource ID for the proper presence icon.
getPresenceIconResourceId(int).FullName: public static final int getPresenceIconResourceId (int status)

ClassDesc: A status update is linked to a @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Data_E@ row and captures the user's latest status update via the corresponding source, e.g. "Having lunch" via "Google Talk". There are two ways a status update can be inserted: by explicitly linking it to a Data row using @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PresenceColumns#DATA_ID_E@ or indirectly linking it to a data row using a combination of @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PresenceColumns#PROTOCOL_E@ (or @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PresenceColumns#CUSTOM_PROTOCOL_E@) and @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PresenceColumns#IM_HANDLE_E@. There is no difference between insert and update, you can use either. Inserting or updating a status update for the user's profile requires either using the @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PresenceColumns#DATA_ID_E@ to identify the data row to attach the update to, or @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#StatusUpdates#PROFILE_CONTENT_URI_E@ to ensure that the change is scoped to the profile. You cannot use @B_android#content#ContentResolver#update_E@ to change a status, but @B_android#content#ContentResolver#insert_E@ will replace the latests status if it already exists. Use @B_android#content#ContentResolver#bulkInsert_E@ to insert/update statuses for multiple contacts at once.
